revised_title: Discrete Properties of Random Surfaces: Analysis and Modeling
tldr: This article presents a new approach to measuring surface parameters in tribology using discrete random process analysis. The authors develop expressions for important parameters like peak curvature in terms of discrete ordinates and the correlation function. They also introduce a new statistical model of the surface that can be used for various types of engineering surfaces. The study focuses on the effects of sampling interval and uses a three-point model to simplify the measurement of complex parameters.
